title: Make the library into your bedroom and have sex in the stacks.
Finally meet the dazzling Denice Cassaro.
Buy season hockey tickets; heckle the goalies.
Go to the Cornell-Harvard men's hockey game and throw fish on the ice.
Sing along to "We didn't go to Harvard" with the Cayuga's Waiters.
Sled down Libe Slope during a snow storm.
Take Hotel Administration 4300: Introduction to Wines.
Streak across the Arts Quad.
Take Psych 1101.
Test out Olin Library's musically calibrated steps by throwing stones on them.
Attempt sake bombing at Plum Tree or Miyake in Collegetown.
Order ice cream at the Dairy Bar.
Climb the rock wall in Bartels Hall.
Listen to a full chimes concert from the clock tower and guess the songs played.
Register for classes during Orientation, then switch out of every single one by the time Add/Drop ends.
Wear flip-flops to class in January.
Go to the Fuertes Observatory and gaze at meteor showers.
Have a snowball fight in May.
Milk a cow.
Skip class to play frisbee on the Arts Quad.
Bury a bottle of Bacardi on the Slope. Dig it up on Slope Day..
Pick apples at the Cornell Orchards.
Attend the Apple Festival on the Commons in the fall.
Flirt with your professor.
Bomb a prelim.
Ace the next one to save your grade.
Attend Hotelie prom.
Meet Happy Dave from Okenshield's and take a picture with him.
Turn your face blue from screaming at midnight before the first finals.
Get heartburn at the Chili Cook-off in the Commons.
Enjoy Ithaca's two months of warm weather — spend a summer here!.
Go to a Shabbat dinner at 104 West and charge it to Cornell Card.
Watch the AAP students parade on Dragon Day.
Enjoy corn nuggets at The Nines.
Build a snow penis or count how many you see around campus.
Dress up and view The Rocky Horror Picture Show at Risley.
Take a class you think is impossible just for fun.
Go on a wine tour.
Kiss on the suspension bridge at midnight.
Sleep through your alarm for your 1:25 class.
Shop at the Friends of the Library Book Sale.
Get out of a University parking ticket.
Buy an Ithaca Is Gorges t-shirt, then get sick of wearing it and buy a variation (Ithaca Is Gangsta).
Learn the "Alma Mater", "Evening Song", and "Give My Regards to Davy".
Attend an opening at the Johnson Museum of Art.
Smuggle food from the dining hall and run for your life as they try to get back your stolen cookies.
Do the Walk of Shame.
Have dinner at a professor's house.
Get wasted at a professor's house.
Have lunch with President Skorton in Trillium; ask if he's done with that burger.
Play a game of tag in the Kroch Library stacks.
See a play at the Schwartz Center.
Rush the field at the last home football game of the season.
Attend a Cornell Night.
Gamble at Turning Stone (try not to lose money).
Watch dancers fly through the air at a Bhangra show.
Have a midnight picnic in the Cornell Plantations.
Wait half an hour for a Terrace Salad.
Ignore any and all "No Winter Maintenance" signs; slip and fall on the icy stairs.
Sit in Libe Café when you have no work; watch the studiers down gallons of coffee.
Write an angry letter to the editor of The Sun.
Go to Wegmans on a Friday or Saturday night.
Explore the secret underground tunnel between Uris and Olin libraries.
See the library's Rare Book Collection.
Pretend you are Harry Potter and study in the Law School library.
See the brain collection in Uris Hall.
Eat at Taverna Banfi (formerly Banfi's) and charge it to CornellCard.
Buy beer at Jason's in Collegetown and charge it to CityBucks.
Take PAPL 2010: Magical Mushrooms, Mischievous Molds.
Take part in a psychology experiment.
Take an unplanned nap in a library.
Take over a building.
According to legend, watch a virgin cross the Arts Quad and then witness A.D. White and Ezra Cornell shake hands.
Live through an Ithaca blizzard and tell your friends how you survived frostbite.
Throw a flaming pumpkin into the gorge.
Play co-ed intramural innertube water polo.
Spend all your lectures figuring out the day's Sudoku. While sitting for the final, wish you had taken notes instead..
Hook up with your T.A..
Order a PMP at the Hot Truck.
Play trivia at Rulloff's on a Sunday night.
Go back for karaoke night on Monday.
Get fishbowls at Level B and collect all the animals.
Hit up Group Therapy on Wednesdays at Dunbar's.
Go bowling at Helen Newman Lanes.
Hand out quartercards on Ho Plaza.
Drive your car up and down Libe Slope or Ho Plaza.
Have a friend's parents take you out to eat at John Thomas Steakhouse or Boatyard Grill.
Eat a chicken parm sandwich from Louie's Lunch.
Eat breakfast at 2 a.m. at the State Diner.
Males: Get thrown out of Balch Hall.
Hook up with a freshman.
Go skinny dipping in a gorge.
Walk to the Commons and back.
Go to an a cappella concert.
Eat in the Risley dining hall.
Write a message on the wall at Collegetown Pizza.
Sell back your books; use money to buy alcohol.
Drink bubble tea.
Eat a Pinesburger.
Walk to a fraternity party with your entire freshman floor.
Go to a fraternity party as a senior; convince yourself you were never one of them.
Get lost in Collegetown during Orientation Week.
Get rejected at a bar because the bouncer knows the person whose I.D. you are using.
See a foreign film at Cinemapolis or Fall Creek Theater.
Eat mongo at RPCC.
See a concert at Barton Hall.
Gain the freshman 15, pay $300 for a gym membership and don't go.
Eat brunch on North Campus.
Do your Freshman Reading Project before you graduate.
Fail your swim test, just for kicks.
Tailgate for homecoming.
Be a model in the Cornell Fashion Collective's annual fashion show.
Host a prefrosh.
Request a song to be played on the clock tower.
Get guilt-tripped into giving blood.
Get asked if you are pregnant at Gannett (males and females).
Drink with your R.A..
Make a chalking; weep when it rains that night.
Sing drunk on the drunk bus.
Meet Bill Nye '77, "The Science Guy",  and give him a hug.
See how long you can go without doing laundry.
Go on a road trip to Canada, flirt with the border patrol, smuggle booze back.
Try to order pizza from a Blue Light phone.
Go to the sex shop on the Commons.
Get drunk on Slope Day, run into Vice President Susan Murphy '73.
Complain about the Slope Day headliners.
Get tapped for a secret society.
Go to Pyramid Mall, realize it is  severely lacking, then drive to Carousel Mall  in Syracuse.
Attend Cross Country Gourmet at a dining hall near you.
Complain about your writing seminar.
Walk holding hands around Beebe Lake.
Visit the Sciencenter.
Watch a soccer game at Mama T's, crammed in like a sardine.
Get J.A.'d for urinating on the Law School.
Hook up with someone randomly and then see them every day afterward.
Go to a coffee house in Just About Music (JAM).
See how many people you can cram into your dorm room.
Watch people play Dance Dance Revolution in Appel.
Write dirty messages with rocks in the gorge.
Ride a horse at Oxley Equestrian Center.
Ring the giant bell in the Plantations.
Crash a political rally on Ho Plaza.
Do the COE ropes course.
Attend a show at the State Theatre.
Make a prank call to the CIT HelpDesk.
Wake up at 7 a.m. for CoursEnroll, then realize that your choice classes are full anyway.
Ski at Greek Peak.
Take a night prelim near the vet school, walk back in the dark.
Trespass on Alumni Fields.
Ask Uncle Ezra a question.
Take the BASICS program.
Walk to class in the snow, uphill both ways.
Buy a Cornell-grown apple from a vending machine.
Furnish an apartment/dorm room entirely with items from the Dump & Run.
Eat at each dining hall at least once.
Ask for an extension on a term paper.
Take part in Holi and get colorful.
Prepare to pull an all-nighter at Uris Library by drinking three Mountain Dews and two cups of coffee; accomplish nothing due to an inability to sit still.
Tell a professor what you really think of his/her class.
Attend a Sun organizational meeting: go to cornellsun.com for details.
Climb all 161 steps to the top of McGraw Tower.
